text: After seeing previous reviews on here, I'm not sure if the reviews really make a difference. I don't think they really care but I'm gonna add one anyway. First...ZERO personality. Not necessarily rude (In my case) but definitely not going to go above and beyond to help. And you definitely get the vibe that it won't take much for the rude attitudes to come out. We were registering 3 vehicles at the same time. 3 separate windows.  All 3 cars on the same insurance card. Showed proof of insurance on our phones. 2 vehicles "checked out" just fine. Third vehicle didn't go through when she typed the number. With zero desire to help out, she made us go get the proof of insurance printed out. Brought it back, waited in line again, and she typed in the EXACT SAME POLICY NUMBER and handed the paper back to my wife with the new tag....... Seriously?

So they want to charge you an astronomical amount for TAGGING your vehicle to drive which is REQUIRED IN ALL 50 GD STATES! And then want to play with your money. This is 2017. EVERYONE USES DEBIT CARDS!!!!!!! The people are unprofessional that work there and are crooks. I'm putting in a BBB complaint NOW. Don't waste your time using them. They may be closer to you but not worth the implied ease.

name: Tiffany Michelle
text: Alabama DHR commissioner Nancy Buckner can not return phone calls. She is unwilling to help DHR clients. Not sure why she is an employee of the Dhr. Staff at any DHR office cannot return from calls. They always placed the blame on somebody else when you have an issue and you need help they will not help you. The dhr's phones are always down. The workers voicemail is always full. If you leave a written message at the desk they still dont return your call. They have about 20 holidays a year too. Also you get 2 hours a day Monday through Thursday to be able to call your worker. Those are the Child support case workers call hours and Thursdays they are not available because they are doing intake for new clients. I was also told by director Renigia Coleman that they have only 3 Case workers for 60,000 cases. When you  Ask to speak with a supervisor or a boss of a supervisor, you're told the call governor Kay Ivey. Felica Powell, Sam Gambino, Renigia Coleman,  Petra Ellis, Mena Rueso, are all guilty of not helping clients. Money is being taken out of every  single one of my child support checks. Thousands of dollars each year. The DHR cant tell me where the money is going. Bruce Ikner who supposedly retired had been endorsing my child checks and money has been missing. They claim they keep no bank records.  Asked for a State hearing with their hearing officer who had to record meeting because she was falling asleep during the meeting. A hearing should be held with someone who doesnt work for the crooks at the DHR. No wonder why they keep getting sued. They are taking money that is to benefit the well being of my child and lining their pockets with it. They have been doing this for 10 years. They also can ever help you with your case as far as changes or help with a review of child support. It takes them 3 years or more to do when all other states take a few weeks to make changes. Once again because they cant do anything to help it effects the well being of my children.

name: Stella Dallas
text:
Their requirements are intrusive and they get worse year after year after year. They have a high turnover with no person lasting more than a year or 2 and the ones that last longer are bitter and apathetic. If if you don't have to deal with them try not to.

For example if you get approved for food stamps one year, the next year they add more requirements. If if you get approved to foster or adopt, the next year they add more requirements and in addition to adding more requirements they are very intrusive.  They want to come into your home every few months and control the setup of your home. They want to contact your employer's they want to look at your bank statements they want your doctor records. Everything with them requires them digging into all of your information and then you often are denied whatever you applied for anyway or you are given the worst option or choice of what you were trying to get in the first place. If you need help, Dhr will make you angry. If you are trying to help, DHR will also make you angry.

Also while they gather all your infirmation you are kept in the dark about everything. They dont tell you anything. Workers are often off work thursday to Monday so the information tunnel doesnt flow both ways.

During the time i have had to deal with them, i have been ordered to get various equipment for my home, been ordered to get various shots, and ordered to take class after class. If you think you have ever completed the requirements for dhr, think again. New requirements are added anytime they meet with you. Yet the rich or churches dont have to do or prove anything to keep DHR out of their hair. Churches volunteer with kids all the time and no one does background checks ir anything.

text: I live at 16080 Alabama Highway South and these guys are the absolute worst. I have resorted to breaking down garbage into itty bitty bags, so that I can actually get the service that I pay for.   Evidently, they are too weak to pick the bags up themselves or perhaps just to lazy..   Please tell your men that if these bags are way too heavy for their weak bodies to please knock on my door.  I'll come personally put the trash in the truck myself.  And then if that doesn't work, I'll put them in even smaller grocery bags.  Surely, that they can handle those. I'm truly embarrassed for you all!    And P.S., if your not going to pick it up, please stop throwing off the lid and leaving it near the road.   I'm tired of water getting in the container.  It only makes my job worse, since evidently it's not yours!  I've been battling this for years!

They are very well organized and efficient and my friendly. you're always ready to answer any questions and get you the right information that you need. If you lived in this area this would be the place for you to go. The one picture is three generations voting in my family.

name: Grant M.
text: Wonderful experience. The woman who helped me was extremely helpful and was the best DMV employee I’ve ever worked with. Had a problem getting a tag on a new commercial vehicle due to a misprint from the dealer, and she was very attentive and helpful getting it sorted out. If I didn’t have that one paperwork issue, I would have been in and out in less than 30 mins. Will be coming here again.

name: Traci Reason
text: Traveled to this location from Leeds because it had the best reviews. I’m a firm believer in reading reviews before I spend time or money. Got there about 10:50 and it was nearly empty, only one person in the tag line and one in the driver’s license line. Social distancing stickers clearly marked on the floor. Helpful greeter, efficient staff, in and out in about 45 minutes...would have been quicker had I not needed two new tags and license because we recently moved to Jeff Co. By the time we left the line was much longer, so go before lunch! Overall, highly recommended this location!!

name: Jenisha Shrestha
text: Best DMV experience ever!!

name: Lisa Woods
text: I love going there the staff the are polite and friendly and their ready to answer any questions that I might have

name: B G
text: Very rude and not helpful to anyone .As I waited in line I heard how they were treating people want it wasn't any different with me.

name: Laura Dean
text: Joycelyn at the DL renewal area was FABULOUS! She was kind and answered all my questions without attitude! Thank you Gardendale DMV for a pleasant experience!

name: Christian Rhodes
text: After I walked through the door, I recieved my tag renewal within 5 minutes. Friendly people, fast service. I refuse to go anywhere else for my DMV needs.

name: Thomas Funkhauser
text: Incredible experience here! Talked to Melinda or Melina (forgot her exact name) however she was very sweet, helpful, and extremely energetic. I never thought id say this but I enjoyed being at the DMV and hung out for a bit after the fact!

name: Larry Hover
text: The old lady on #17 business line was very rude and with an attitude. Needs to be fired

name: Caleb Shirley
text: First of all, the wait times are almost zero. Come in and you may stand in line for a couple of minutes that's it. Second of all, the staff here is so kind and attentive to your needs. They will try to help you as much as possible and they are so kind while doing so. Any other DMV I probably would have been asked to leave with all the problems I had trying to get title and registration for my out of state salvage title car, but at this location they helped me through ever step and never made me feel like I was a burden. This is the DMV you should be going to.

name: Meaghan Quick
text: Kayla made my experience so easy and simple! She answered all my questions with no frustrations she was so pleasant and friendly. I believe she went the extra mile with me today.  Excellent customer service Kayla!

name: Mega Boombox
text: Very neat and clean. Staff was very helpful. Remember that they do not accept debit cards.

name: Shawn Taylor
text: Angela was fantastic on my recent visit to the Gardendale annex. She helped me renew my tags and swap vehicles with any gripes. Was friendly and efficient. Thank you Angela.

name: Ronnie Logan
text: This DMV office is not like the rest of them. This office is very friendly and helpful. !! Kayla was very nice over the phone and help with everthing I needed .

Its 2019 thats ridiculous so i had to leave to find a atm and now im sitting in line instead of being at work. Atleast have an ATM inside if your only gonna take cash.

Don't tell anyone! 😉

name: Rebecca Richardson
text: This satellite court building for Blount county serves the western area of the county. There is a sheriff sub-station and office, plus they also have the revenue office, tags and licenses. The staff is professional and very helpful. You can also renew your pistol permit here as well.

name: Phyllis Smith
text: It would be super if the website was kept current and/or updated to say "closed for renovation"!

name: Joy McCormack
text: Never a long wait! Always fast in and out. Staff is helpful.

name: Brad Harkness
text: Was nice to have something close by and the ladies there was super friendly and no one person in line when I arrived. In and out!

name: Becky Campbell
text: There is one person working in the license department. You are required to sign in and line up against a concrete wall and stand. No chairs are provided and sitting on the floor is prohibited. There were several elderly people that had been standing well over an hour when I arrived. I have a broken ankle and had to stand an hour and a half to find out I couldn’t get what I needed. A young man came in for a cdl study book while I was there and the employee refused to simply hand him a book. He was told to sign in and stand in line.

name: Will C
text: I think that the courthouse is one of the best parts of Scottsboro. It always looks nice on the inside and out. I received my boating license here and it was a very nice experience. My grandfather also used to take me in the do different things when I was little. Five Stars

text: Exemplary service.  I went on 04/30/2021. The staff was very efficient, and knowledgeable. I made two trips that day and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes either time. Even interacting with the security guards was enjoyable, (they had a crew of jokers working the front door). I hope they are able to maintain the atmosphere and efficiency over the long term.

name: brookelynn leduc
text: I was hesitant about going due to previous DMV and other services being rude etc. This was not the case! They were very helpful, respectful, clean environment. I was in and out less than ten minutes.

name: Krista Hahn
text: Guards were nice. I checked in and was called back immediately. Ladies at the counter were sweet. Nice facility. I was in and out in 10 minutes on Wednesday morning.

name: Paul (Paulie)
text: My experience here was great. Security guards were kind, it took less than 5 minutes from me getting my ticket to getting called up to the probate office, and the ladies that helped me were very friendly and efficient. I brought a checkbook just in case (every adult should do this anyways) and I had no problems.

name: Sarah Stewart
text: Very nice building with easy check in procedure. Had a short wait, and a very nice clerk told us they don't issue learner's permits there, so FYI. Would recommend for other services.

name: Jacob Lipina
text: Huge, clean waiting area, easy ticketing system via touchscreen kiosk, and plenty of employees helping process people. Fastest auto registration ive ever had. Went 10am on a Wednesday.

name: MarMusicGen
text: Donot go here to apply for your passport. I went on 4/7/21 and the Dept. Of State didn't received my application til 5/12/21.   It already take 10-12 weeks for processing but now my application is over a month behind.  I would've given my  money to the Post office if I would've known that it would take this long.

name: Gheymarne
text: This place is pretty nice. I am happy to have been able to explore the entire building. My Dad was able to get a court document notarized. While I was able to explore mapping. The young lady who helped me was extremely knowledgeable. She was able to clear up lots of questions about tax leins and purchases of tax leins. She was able to pull my property right up and help me determine as best we could without a surveyer where the line was. I have been waiting to do this a couple months. The swivel computer was extremely helpful in assisting me. Viewing it was very easy. Be aware the stop letting people in at 4:45. Metal detectors also in place so be aware when going in. However they have to scanner to check bags and security just like the previous building. It's much more accessible now that I don't have to ride a block multiple times to find parking. Very nice establishment. So we are clear they don't do driver testing here.

name: MATT
text:
No one wants to answer the phones. Busy or straight to voicemail. Its like you are calling a angry ex, that does not want to talk.
This a official government office. This conduct is and shold not be accepted.
Hire more to fill the gaps if needed. They also shut down for 1 hour lunch. 12 to 1

text: Can’t ever get them on the phone

name: Gabe Muro
text: Terrible experience. They turned our marriage certificate down because it was handwritten and its their "internal office procedure". My wife has impeccable handwriting so it was just them being lazy. They couldn't produce any written rule about handwritten forms whatsoever and the young lady was just unconcerned with processing our form. Keep in mind this was at 3:30pm...30 minutes before they close. It says nothing of such on the website. We ended up driving over to the Bessemer Courthouse and had zero issues with the same document. Bessemer was extremely nice and helpful.

name: Mary Barnfield
text: I called 5 days straight 4 times a day- pressed option 1 and ABSOLUTELY NO ONE ANSWERED. Can’t possibly be that busy.  Wish I could give zero stars .

name: Kimberley Davidson
text: Reached out to the JeffCo Probate Court regarding a certificate of formation I filed. I wanted to find out when the documents had been sent to the state. The lady that was assisting me, put me on hold, but I had to hang up. To my surprise she called me back and provided the necessary information I'd requested. She was very professional, and thorough and provided the best customer service. So often we are quick to criticize so I wanted to provide a very positive experience. I have to be honest, I was not expecting a call back so kudos to the workers in the probate court. Thank you for providing GREAT customer service!

name: Tasha Thompson
text: Disappointed I have to give them a star..... they never answer the phone. Ever. They don’t respond to emails.  Horrible county courthouse.

It takes more than 4 trips back and forth to fill out a marriage from that takes less than 3 mins have they had a computer station. Staff assume everyone knows everything already and will never tell you everything you need to save you time and efforts. They get paid for no work. Five couples infront if md with same complain, and definitely Form should be edited. rules should be printed out and handed or verbally spoken to every client. This should be a happy place for happy people to obtain official documents. Management should take this department to a whole new upgrade.

name: Eddie Thomas
text: It was a great experience,  jury duty...

name: Bradley
text: Avoid window #6! You will recognize her as over-weight, bleached hair, and a very mean looking face. I wish I had wrote her name down. This women needs to lose her job immediately. I was there for a simply name change for my adopted daughter and this women refused to look at and process my paperwork because I used the forms and process from the Bessemer office website. She wouldn't even look at the documents! I did persist and the manager was called in to help and she found all my paperwork to be in order and correct. Thank you Ms Jones! Window #5 was also very nice and helpful and she was a joy to work with. But, #6 tainted what was going to be a memorable and joyful day for my adopted daughter. Finally gaining the last name of her new family. Just to be sure I got the window #6 correct, its the same one in this picture where the man with the blue shirt and ball cap is standing.

name: Andy Scott
text: I have a simple question, but cannot get through to speak with anybody. Government at its finest. Overpaid to do nothing.

name: penny kitty
text: I have been very pleased every time that I have been to the probate office. I have been several times in several months,  the girls that work there are very nice and helpful!

name: Troy Reynolds
text: The Clerks on the Judicial side of probate court made my name change such an easy process. I was meet with a friendly greeting , all of my questions answered and was in and out fairly quickly. Thank you ,  Alicia, Tiffany and Tam. You ladies were wonderful on a Good Friday.

name: Meghan Hall
text: Whenever I call the recording department they are usually prompt at answering the phone, and try to be helpful.  They are not always able to help find some older documents recorded in the county, but I wonder if they just don't have time to search for anything that isn't already on their computer system.

name: Alacyia Hall
text: I tried calling the phone number provided on the probate court website. It lists of a handful of recorded options to direct your call. For all other option of other departments it say press '4'. Once you press '4' it tells you to go on the website to see a list of all other departments. WHAT CRAZINESS IS THIS??? I called because I clearly want to talk to someone. Not look at a list of departments with no way to actually talk to a person. That is just the craziest thing ever!!!

name: James W
text: The clerks at the main downtown Birmingham division of the Jefferson County Probate Court have been very helpful to me, with a special shout out to the clerk Tiffany who is of Vietnamese ancestry.  Tam is also super, as is Melody, Judge King's Assistant, and also Betty is very helpful.  James West

name: Darcy Moseley
text: I called to see what it would cost to Probate my mother's Will,  a female voice comes on the recording to press whatever you need. The phone rings forever, never got an answer. Its too cold to be driving from Irondale to downtown to get an answer. I need to know how much it will cost, if they take cash, checks, money orders, debit cards, whatever but none of the Yahoos will answer the phone. They have GREAT GOVERNMENT JOBS BUT WILL NOT DO THEIR JOBS. JESUS CHRIST, JUST ANSWER THE PHONE. IS ANYONE READING OUR COMPLAINTS???? SERIOUSLY!

name: Vickie Harris
text: Tiffany on the judicial side was very helpful. She guided me through on issues that I didn’t understand. She also was friendly and had a smile during the time spent with her.

name: Justin Williams
text: What’s the point of having a phone if they never answer it. Pick up the phones or get rid of them.

name: Diana Hancock

name: Jack Smith
text:
This is one of the most poorly managed state service departments I've ever worked with. I joined two of the Jefferson County Probate employees on a call to find a solution.

They persisted to yell at each other and try to overstep each others answers. I hired an attorney to solve the problem and he eventually got it taken care of.

Good luck if you're pursuing an issue with your personal time.

text: I called the "Name Change" information line to ask about NAME CHANGES because I'm getting married and I need to CHANGE MY NAME, and the lady who answered "Doesn't know, doesn't know, doesn't know, huffff hufff, doesn't know, huff!" Very helpful- THANKS!

text: I was having a problem with the new garbage service, frustrated with being unable to reach anyone after 2 weeks of calls I called the commission office. Sonya was extremely friendly and helpful. She was very understanding of the issue and took all my information. She promised to get in contact with the company for me. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

name: Marsha Hilliard
text: Walked in only person  in line around 9:00am.  I was here to buy my tags and was there a total of 3 minutes.  I have learned not to go at last minute. Go before last day. Work has been done to courthouse.  Looks very nice.

name: Tim Palmer
text:
My wife called the tag office requesting assistance with the filing of a lost title. My father in law had past, and the vehicle has been sitting for two years. The person answering the call was rude from the begining. After explaining what was needed, my wife received a five minute lecture on how "it was a crime if she was lying about her sibling's approval for filing the title, and it's a felony if she were to get caught!" This person knew nothing of our situation, and immediately accused her of being there for fradulent purposes!
We called back to explain her experience to a supervisor, only to be told the office was aware of this person's constant rude behavior. The supervisor apoligized and provided instructions for what we needed to do. After gathering the information and going to the tag office, this associate continually barked over the person helping my wife! The person continually asked what my wife was trying to do. Mind you, they were not the person assisting us! It upsets me to know this is the approved treatment for Colbert county citizens when dealing with this office! I have never experienced such unprofessional behavior! It's shocking and totally unacceptable!
Thankfully, Kayla and Lauren were there to help us through the filing! It was the opposite of the previous experience.... They were fantastic!

name: Renae Miller
text: Nice, professional folks

name: Ultimate Gingy Gaming
text: Very rude and unprofessional

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Gotten my tag from several counties before and they always let me choose from the stack of tags they had available. But here they were going to let me do the same until another lady there made up a rule that said I wasn't allowed

name: Marvin Washington
text: Renewing tag

name: Mag Prime
text: Can't contact these folks. The phone number is just for show so that Alabama dhr can say they have one but it's inoperable by design. Y'all ain't fooling anybody.

name: Treva Rocha
text: This is the absolute worst organization I have ever dealt with. You cannot get anyone to answer their direct lines or call you back and if you call the main line to speak with someone or get help, you are only able to put in a name or extension or the system hangs up on you. It should be much easier to reach an operator for assistance when correct numbers or emails are not provided.

name: Angie Tate
text: No one ever answers the phone. They make you jump through fifty hoops before they even act like they care. I know a poor child that is being abused and they have not tried to help at all. They won't even call me back after I went up there and left the information. Terrible experience!

name: X
text: If you do not like dealing with people, find another profession. It is impossible to speak with an actual person, if you call the number, you are directed to enter an extension, however, if you don’t know or have an extension, your call is dropped. That to me, is absolutely ridiculous. You guys really need to do better, many people would rather not have to go through this and have the means to not be on public assistance so it makes it that much more uncomfortable when you can’t even get proper customer service. If you cant at least answer the phone, why is there even this new office?...Just go virtual. Then maybe some of you would see what it feels like to be on the other end of the spectrum, by no longer having work or the means to provide for your family.

name: Mille Bott
text: This place is absolutely horrible. They never answer the phone, and they sure as hell dont help anyone. They never call back and they lie saying the contacted you back. In 2 years of an open case Brittany Peeler has not once answered my phone calls or called me back after leaving numerous voicemails.

name: Ariana Palma
text: Can’t contact these people for NOTHING. It says “wait time is two minutes” over and over. Like what in the world what the hell is the point of even having a phone number online if it doesn’t work. Irritating as hell.

name: Nesha S
text: I think this office takes the cake on horrible customer service. You can never get ahold of anyone. The number that's provided online and on your paperwork looks like it's strictly automated. It just keeps asking for an extension that is/was never provided and after 3 times of asking, it just hangs up. I believe they need to get new people who actually wants to work and actually help people who is in need of assistance. Beause this is NOT it.

name: Tina Pike
text: We have a client in our drug treatment facility that has tried to get a hold of the foodstamp dept.  In Madison Coynty It ask to press 1 for English then enter an extention, she don't know the extention! No option to press for operator, this is ridiculous!!

name: Dee Dee1969
text: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!! I just had an phone interview with this lady who was very nasty. She was very rude and uncaring. Do you know how hard it is for some people to ask for help???? Just to be spoken down to like I'm a nobody! I'm so furious! That lady has no business with a job where she speaks to people. She has no customer service skills. She is not better than the people that come there and ask for help. She acted like it's coming out of her own pockets! I've been putting taxes into this state for 34 years straight, why can't Alabama help me when I need it? I've only need ebt only once before my adult life. So why can I get help when I need it?  Very disappointed, and very upset! :( UPDATE: I was told I make too much money based off my gross. Gross! I don't see all that money! And they do not factor in medical expenses. I take 5 different prescriptions and my fridge is completely empty due to car repairs. I am with no food. Now, I've been taking medication with no food. This is very dangerous health wise. IF ANYTHING HAPPENS TO ME BECAUSE THEY REFUSED TO HELP ME, MY BLOOD IS ON THEIR HANDS. THEY DO NOT GIVE A DAMN ABOUT NO ONE. THE WHOLE STAFF NEEDS TO BE REPLACED!

name: Korrin Winters
text:
Cannot believe the despicable attitude I was met with before even asking 2 simple questions (am i speaking with the correct department & could i speak to someone for help with something not food assistance related?)
Ms. Calvin was so incredibly rude for no reason and laughed multiple times when I asked to speak with her supervisor.
I hope when she needs help someone laughs in her face before she can even ask, too. How unprofessional?

name: Amberly Nicole
text: Horrible service. The workers in the office act like they don't care at all. And so I came home and called up there hoping to speak with someone a little higher up. Well their attitude is just as bad. Zero friendliness,  and they act like your a problem for them,  instead of a client!!

name: April Hullett
text: The debit card that is issued for child support payment was used fraudulently. They were able to access my pin and withdrew all the money leaving me $3. They don’t enforce child support at all. text: Don't seem to want to help. Don't be fooled by the "We are only here to help". Bs.  I think they enjoy ripping families apart. We weren't home one day when she randomly popped in unannounced and our kids are threatened to be put into Foster care.  HOW IS THAT EVEN LEGAL?!  She's trying to make everything damn near impossible for everyone involved ..why...? So she can take my kids to Foster care. I mean every week, something new arises. Some problem she comes up with, she searches for issues against us(me) or comes up with some new rule we must NOW begin to follow or else. Or else what? Foster care of course. Making it extremely difficult or damn near impossible why? So we fail, mess up, and BAM. Her wish comes true- Foster care!  I know there's other kids out there that are probably being beaten, starved, and exposed to God knows what. But those are the poor kids that slip thru the cracks and thru the system. name: Elizabeth Crane
text: I am a single mother working at the hospital and have worked there for many years. I need help because I only survive on ONE income and I have an 8 year old son. I made a phone interview appt and they scheduled it for Tuesday at 9am, yet they called Monday at 8am. Then I called and scheduled a second appt, and got that in the mail....only 2 days after receiving my 2nd appt notice and when it would be, they sent another letter saying my fs application had been denied bc I didn't keep my appointment and failed to call the office to schedule another one!!! So I tried calling back up there, yet, to my surprise I couldn't get a hold of anyone and tried 3 different numbers. Someone or multiple people there obviously don't know what's going on and need to get organized. I understand I am dependant on them for help...but how am I supposed to get help when no one is available to ever help me, or can't keep an appt date and time correct. Someone is dropping the ball and I'd like to know what management is doing about this! This is NOT OKAY TO TREAT PEOPLE LIKE THIS!! I will be contacting a supervisor and hope that they can solve this problem. Just look at your rating?!!?? Obviously there is a problem. And I think that problem is called laziness and a lack of compassion for people stuggling.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text:
DHR only cares about cases and how much work they can do. If they think you will cave, they will threaten you with a Safety Plan and make you think they are putting your kids in Foster Care, if you do not sign it. Do not trust DHR. If DHR contacts you please get an attorney before you go see them. BEFORE YOU TALK TO DHR, PLEASE HAVE AN ATTORNEY.

If you do cave and sign it, they might tell you its only 45 days and its all over, but thats a LIE. Its 45 days for the case worker on the Safety Plan to create a petition against you that an Attorney has and presents to a judge against you. There is actually 60 days till they decide to drop it or make charges. They may say they will get you a free attorney, but get your own before they can cause any trouble to begin with. Also the attorney that is free is for your children so that DHR can make sure the children are safe. Safe against who, well that is you of course. You are getting a free attorney to prosecute you. Thanks DHR.

But wait there is more. During your so called Safety Plan they are going to want you to come in after 30 days and sign a ISP. That is an Individualized Service Plan. But you are on a Safety Plan already, so why do you need a new plan.  Well its so DHR can threaten you again. We were told they could have Foster Care there that day to take the kids. So you still don't have an Attorney and they scare you again into signing a new plan.

Well its 2 months into it now. DHR will make you take Classes. Any class they can to prolong the case and assure they are making more money. The longer the case is open, the more cases they can show they have and get more money from the state. You will have attended another ISP and most likely through out all of this DHR will have told you very little and you half of what they told you is a Lie. They might say they were super busy and sorry I sent you the wrong document. Sorry I never said that time, and change you visitation times. Sorry I meant you both need to take these classes now, but you said only I had to.

Well by now, you have finished your Classes and after trying really hard to have DHR get back with you, so your kids can come home, you finally get your kids back. Its been 3 to 4 months now.  Things are getting better.

But wait there is more. DHR can still investigate you another 90 days. Or so I was told. Maybe it is 90 days until she says my carpet is to dirty and adds on another 90 days. Who knows but they will continue to investigate you and your child's school for months, to a year, or even years.

Hopefully if you get Attorney before you ever speak with DHR. Your attorney will tell you what to NOT SAY and what to NOT DO so that DHR doesn't have any AMMO against you.  Get an Attorney to go with you to meet DHR. Do Not Go Alone like me and get abused by DHR. I am still paying for it.

text:
Tried to get my license plates switched over from California about two months ago, the lady who helped me said I needed the title number and gave me a form to fill out. After two months of back and forth with my financing company they finally got the title number to me, I returned to the office and gave them the information and they said they needed a copy of the title. I called my financing company and they faxed over a copy to the licensing office, which didn’t have the title number printed on it, but I had it printed on the form which they had given me.

I return to inform them a copy was faxed and then they said I needed the original title. The lady who helped me said ‘I’m gonna get you a new form’ then proceeded to just blot out with pen, on the form I already had filled out, the words that said ‘copy’ and ‘fax to’ then said I need to have my financing company mail the original title. I asked her why was I told differently the first time, and then I asked her if scratching words out with pen on an already filled out form counts as a new form, because that seems confusing and unprofessional, and she started getting visibly angry. I said thank you for your help and left before things escalated, but she was rude and condescending, and unwilling to answer my questions. I can’t believe how unprofessional and disorganized this office is. I am beyond angry and disappointed.

I received a ticket for driving on expired tags. 1 yr ago, when I was SUPPOSE to be renewing my tags and taking care of life’s little duties, just like normal citizens do every day of the week. I was being kicked out of my home that I had been living in for the past 2 yrs by my PSYCHOLOGICALLY CHALLENGED “best friend of over 20yrs. As a 100% unemployable Navy Veteran my finances are limiting to say the least. I got my tags renewed  the very first Monday after receiving the ticket on Sat. I did not pay my ticket early becuz it took me 3 mnths to save the extra money out of my strained budget. I went to court in my appt date. My name was called up to a table, before the judge had entered the room, and told my ticket had been dismissed!!!!!!! Thus saving me from paying the ADDITIONAL $200 for restitution AND court fees. Everyone was friendly and polite. Although I can NOT think of any reason I would want to visit the Madison Co. Court House again. My experience was surprising and very low stress!
SWM

name: zac creel
text:
On December 2, 2020
A lady carried my cat to this place of business, so they could locate the owner and return him to his family, because she had witness a car putting the cat out of there car. In front of my house, close by the road and drove off. Assuming the person in the car toss out somebody's cat. She stop's and gets the cat and tries to chase down the car that put him out. Unable to do so, she gets a picture of the car and the tag number of the car. Then she see's a state trooper, at the store down the road from my house. So she stopped to report to him what she had just witness. He directs her to the cullman county animal control & shelter, because that is who deals with animal related issue's. So, she goes there and tells the people in the office what she had witness and shows them the picture of the tag number of the car. That put the cat out of their car, and tells them the exact location. Was right off 747 on the corner where "Creel Motor's" house is at. So she leaves my cat there and thinks that they are going to do what they are suppose to do in this situation. Make a effort to find the owner, to relocate the cat with his family. But that isn't what takes place at all. They sent my cat straight to the back room and euthanized it. That day before the close of business. A cat that had never in his life been anything but loving to anyone that, he had ever met before. Keep in mind this cat just got picked up in front of his house by someone he never seen before and going for a intense car ride, to try and chase down another car. With a car full of strangers, and the whole time he is just loving on them like they where family.

text: Seemed more interested in lunch being around the corner than helping with registration.

name: Phil Richards
text: Went to the courthouse to just change my address within Madison city. The take a number system is convenient but the computer didn't have this specific option. I guessed that 'renew license' would do the trick and it worked. The waiting area is very comfortable. All 3 staff members were courteous and professional. The 5 stars are for them.

name: David Rojas
text:
Super friendly and professional staff. They were very friendly, patient and thorough.
Shout out to Mrs. Barbara who went above and beyond to help me. She’s awesome!

name: Blake Hargrove
text: This place is fairly efficient, and the staff is friendly. I called ahead with a couple of questions, of which they went above and beyond answering. It helped me be prepared when I got there. It was about a 15 minute wait, but they were a bit busy, so not a rediculous wait. Once I met with the clerk, I was in and out of there in 5 minutes. Not bad!

name: Morgan Sweatman
text:
Because my dad corrected a date on my car title - scribbled out the number 5 (for May) and put the number 7 (for July) - the woman said, "I can't do this today," and handed me an entire affadavit document that she said needed to be signed and notarized.
EDIT: The affadavit form that she generated for me had the WRONG YEAR on it, which she had to manually enter herself by the way. A correction form. With an incorrect date. Imagine that! Thankfully when I brought the form back, another woman just said, "Well, maybe it'll go through. You'll either get a car tag in the mail or another affadavit." Superb.

I guess to people behind the desk it's all just a big joke, but it's an hour and a half drive to get my dad's signature again because we don't live right next to each other. Thanks for wasting an hour of my day that I could have been at work! Really appreciate the understanding attitude. I also appreciate the woman who told me to "fix my collar - no, like this, no - okay, I guess we'll work with that then," when taking my driver's license photo, among the annoyed, condescending glances. What? Clearly an incredibly professional group of individuals.

name: Tiffany Smith
text: Fast and clean

name: Donna Mahieux
text: I realized on the last business day of the month that I hadn't renewed my car tags.  When I got to the Madison location, it was PACKED but I took my number and waited about an hour and a half.  During this wait, I made sure that I had mine and my husband's driver's license number.  But I realized that I do not have my COURTESY reminder.  I was told by another employee not to worry, they could look up the information.  It was about 4:15 when my number was called.  I politely smiled and acknowledged the lady and explained that I didn't have my form.  Blank stare as though I had asked for her firstborn.  She was so rude and made the comment, "You don't know anything?  Tag numbers, insurance...." that I didn't have time to think that I had that on my phone.  When I explained to her that I was sorry but I understood from another employee that she could look up the information, she left me standing there to go "talk to her right now".  When she got back I was so upset, I left.  Now, I'm driving with expired tags until I can go some place else this morning.  BTW, the lady I later spoke to at Courthouse said that, in fact, there a way to look up my information and renew my tags.  Definitely won't go back there this time.  Maybe next year.

name: Wendy Smith
text: I feel like the luckiest person today! No line at the license replacement! My friend got a title transfer and was seen so quickly! Both ladies who helped us were sweet, kind and didn't sound ugly and rude like many I have dealt with in previous occasion at different locations. Please, keep up the good work!

name: Cathy
text: For car tag registration it has always been my experience that the Teller at Station #4 is  EXTREMELY rude and lacks customer service etiquette.  During my last visit she was sarcastic and practically yelled at my 80 year old Mother for not responding to a notice that was sent by mail, however due to her age she couldn’t recall receiving it.  Nonetheless, that behavior is totally unacceptable.

name: Chris Reynolds
text: Wait time is ridiculously long...2 hours. The place is packed and they are only running 3 windows! Definitely not coming back to this location.

name: Robert Thompson
text: Assigned a number upon entering facility. Then sat in a comfortable seat until until my number was called. No standing in line. I have had to wait from 5 to 30 minutes, depending on customer volume .

name: Kimberly Greene
text: Wait time is not bad, depending on volume. Their station setup is somewhat confusing if you're not there for licensing. The staff needs customer service training. They are beyond rude.

name: Andrew H
text: Fastest, friendliest, best DMV experience ever!

name: Andrea Brown
text: Fast service and very helpful staff !!!

name: Kendra Bulman
text: I have been calling this number for 2 weeks now several times a day and it's always busy. I emailed them and got a voicemail saying to call them, so I had and on the 6th try of the day I got through! Told the lady why I was calling and she placed me in hold by putting the phone down on her desk and resumed talking to her friend about how she couldn't understand me. I waited, listening to her conversation for 20 minutes before hanging up. Explains why the number is always busy.

name: Andrea Canerossi-Conyers
text: Short wait time. Was in and out of the office in less than 15 minutes to get a car registration.  Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.

name: Paula Cook
text: This office is the best kept secret in Madison County!  Friendly staff and quick service every time I have gone there.

name: T Voss
text: I love this place! It is so quick and convenient!

name: James Hutson
text: very slow, some good employees. some don't know anything

name: Evgenii Katyshev
text: That was the fastest and the best DMV service I have ever received.

name: John McAlister
text: Exceedingly slow and uninformed personnel managing the site.  Very disappointed.

name: Britt Moore
text: Slow and understaffed. If you work a full-time job plan on taking half the day off from work. Forget about trying to get anything done during lunchtime.

name: Jess Eve Jason
text: A Huge shout out to Rhonda Swain!!! Thanks so very much for all your hard work & guidance.

name: carolyn cole
text: They lady i talked to today about a reinstatement,  after being told by a police officer that we could go to any dmv, said no you can't and threw a  paper at me and she said you have to call this number and walked away from me even though  I was still talking. She was very rude and has no business working with the public

name: Connie bennett
text: Service was fast and friendly

name: Carolyn Hastings
text: Great and friendly service.  Go in the middle of the week for practically no wait time at all.

name: Charlie Hemmings
text: Nice people to talk to not rude very nice

name: James Burton
text: Reasonable service. Try not to go at the end of the month though, or you'll wait awhile.

name: Marie Reynolds
text: Friendly and fast!

name: Owlette Pettit
text: Always fast service when I go.

name: Skip Storm
text: Great staff, fast service, no attitude.

name: Beri Fraley
text: Fast friendly service

name: George Alvarez
text: Great service and short lines.

name: Nick Hof
text: Super long waits and very few employees working at all

name: Chloe McAlister
text: Called and was told one thing, waited in line and found out something completely different.  Long wait times, uninformed employees.  Tax dollars NOT at work.

name: Kimi Alexander
text: Always kind and helpful.

name: Simeon
text: Never much of a wait with tag renewals, but that is because their isn't many people that are there for that ever. The staff are friendly but aren't really focused on their work, which does cause more of a wait for other services.

text: Money hungry hippos.

name: Scott Dickens
text: Worst judge I have ever appeared in front of. Court not once started on time,and she is rude and arrogant.On the final court date she had no notes on my case and seemed as if she felt it was my fault.
